title: Cadia (plant)
text:
Cadia is a genus of <a href="flowering%20plant">flowering plant</a>s in the family <a href="Fabaceae">Fabaceae</a>. It belongs to the subfamily <a href="Faboideae">Faboideae</a>.
Unlike most plants in the Faboideae, it has radially symmetrical <a href="flower">flower</a>s. In related species with bilateral symmetry, such as those of "<a href="Lupinus">Lupinus</a>", the dorsal (upper or adaxial) part of the flower expresses one or more genes in the "Cycloidea" ("CYC")/"Dichotoma" ("DICH") family. In "Cadia", these genes are expressed throughout the flower. Thus, from a molecular point of view, "Cadia" is not reversing the ancestral evolution from radial symmetry to bilateral symmetry, but obtaining radial symmetry from a new mechanism.
